title: Opinion: Opinion | Taliban, Three Years On: Still Searching for Manna
content: On August 15, 2021, the Taliban swiftly took over Kabul following the withdrawal of the US-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), marking a significant diplomatic setback for India.
summary: On August 15, 2021, the Taliban swiftly took over Kabul following the withdrawal of the US-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), marking a significant diplomatic setback for India.

title: Russia Extends Petrol Exports Ban Until 2025 To "Maintain Stable Situation"
content: The Russian government announced Wednesday that it was reintroducing a ban on petrol exports for another six months to "maintain a stable situation" on the domestic fuel market after major price hikes.
summary: The Russian government announced Wednesday that it was reintroducing a ban on petrol exports for another six months to "maintain a stable situation" on the domestic fuel market after major price hikes.

title: Ousted Thai PM Srettha Thavisin Says He "Respects" Court Decision
content: Ousted Thai prime minister Srettha Thavisin said Wednesday that he respected a court ruling that removed him from office in an ethics case.
summary: Ousted Thai prime minister Srettha Thavisin said Wednesday that he respected a court ruling that removed him from office in an ethics case.

title: Rarely Seen Titanic Artefacts Stored In Secret Warehouse In US
content: The collection includes a range of personal belongings and relics, such as handbags, perfume vials still containing fragrances, and countless other items.
summary: The collection includes a range of personal belongings and relics, such as handbags, perfume vials still containing fragrances, and countless other items.

title: France Probes Cyberbullying Of Olympic Boxer Imane Khelif Amid Gender Row
content: France has launched a cyberbullying probe following a complaint by Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif, who was at the centre of a gender controversy at the Paris Olympic Games, prosecutors said on Wednesday.
summary: France has launched a cyberbullying probe following a complaint by Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif, who was at the centre of a gender controversy at the Paris Olympic Games, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

title: Thai Court Removes PM Over Appointment Of Minister With Criminal Conviction
content: Thailand's Constitutional Court removed Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office on Wednesday as it ruled against him in an ethics case that threw the kingdom into fresh political turmoil.
summary: Thailand's Constitutional Court removed Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office on Wednesday as it ruled against him in an ethics case that threw the kingdom into fresh political turmoil.

title: New Zealand Charity Apologises For Donating Sweets Containing Lethal Meth
content: A New Zealand charity apologised on Wednesday for distributing dozens of pineapple-flavoured candies that were found to be laced with potentially lethal amounts of methamphetamine.
summary: A New Zealand charity apologised on Wednesday for distributing dozens of pineapple-flavoured candies that were found to be laced with potentially lethal amounts of methamphetamine.

title: Brian Niccol: The Chipotle Boss Who Has Replaced Indian-Origin Starbucks CEO
content: Brian Niccol will take charge as the Starbucks CEO, effective September 1, the company announced on Wednesday. Mr Niccol, a seasoned executive with a proven track record, will succeed Laxman Narasimhan, who stepped down after just over a year.
summary: Brian Niccol will take charge as the Starbucks CEO, effective September 1, the company announced on Wednesday. Mr Niccol, a seasoned executive with a proven track record, will succeed Laxman Narasimhan, who stepped down after just over a year.

title: Why Starbucks Is Facing Global Boycott Calls: The Controversy Explained
content: Starbucks has come under fire for its alleged connection with Israel. The calls for a boycott intensified, especially after Israel's ongoing war in Gaza killed nearly 40,000 Palestinians and left about 100,000 injured.
summary: Starbucks has come under fire for its alleged connection with Israel. The calls for a boycott intensified, especially after Israel's ongoing war in Gaza killed nearly 40,000 Palestinians and left about 100,000 injured.

title: Elon Musk Shares Breathtaking Aerial View Of Tesla Headquarters. Pic Inside
content: Billionaire Elon Musk has shared a "beautiful" photograph of the Tesla headquarters in Texas, leaving many awestruck.

title: Taliban Mark 3 Years In Power Since Afghanistan Takeover With Military Show
content: Afghanistan's Taliban rulers celebrated three years in power on Wednesday with a military parade paying homage to their homemade bombs used in war, fighter aircraft and goose-stepping security forces.
summary: Afghanistan's Taliban rulers celebrated three years in power on Wednesday with a military parade paying homage to their homemade bombs used in war, fighter aircraft and goose-stepping security forces.

title: Bangladeshi Lawyer Reveals Sheikh Hasina's Secret Jail "House Of Mirrors"
content: Blindfolded, handcuffed and bundled out of his secret prison for the first time in eight years, Bangladeshi barrister Ahmad Bin Quasem held his breath and listened for the sound of a cocked pistol.
summary: Blindfolded, handcuffed and bundled out of his secret prison for the first time in eight years, Bangladeshi barrister Ahmad Bin Quasem held his breath and listened for the sound of a cocked pistol.

title: No Soap, No Water: Girls In War-Torn Gaza Forced To Cut Their Hair
content: When girls complain to Gaza paediatrician Lobna al-Azaiza that they have no comb, she tells them to cut off their hair.
summary: When girls complain to Gaza paediatrician Lobna al-Azaiza that they have no comb, she tells them to cut off their hair.

title: Billionaire Vinod Khosla Calls Elon Musk's Climate Talk To Trump "Dumb"
content: Billionaire venture capitalist Vinod Khosla today slammed Elon Musk over his climate-talk tutorial to Donald Trump, saying his thoughts about CO2 ppm (parts per million) levels and their consequences were simply "dumb".
summary: Billionaire venture capitalist Vinod Khosla today slammed Elon Musk over his climate-talk tutorial to Donald Trump, saying his thoughts about CO2 ppm (parts per million) levels and their consequences were simply "dumb".

title: Tourist Dead After 'Magic Carpet' Ride In China Suddenly Malfunctions
content: The incident has raised concerns about the safety of tourist attractions in China and an inquiry has been launched to determine the cause of the malfunction.

title: Japan PM Fumio Kishida To Step Down Amid Sinking Poll Ratings
content: Japan's unpopular Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is set to quit after announcing on Wednesday he will not seek re-election as party chief.

title: Union Files Labour Charges Against Trump, Musk For "Threatening" Workers
content: The United Auto Workers Union said on Tuesday it has filed complaints with the National Labor Relations Board against Donald Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk over attempts to threaten and intimidate workers.
summary: The United Auto Workers Union said on Tuesday it has filed complaints with the National Labor Relations Board against Donald Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk over attempts to threaten and intimidate workers.

title: Starbucks' Indian-Origin CEO, Recently Fired, Never Worked Past 6 pm
content: Starbucks has replaced its Indian-origin CEO Laxman Narasimhan with Brian Niccol, chief executive at Chipotle.
summary: Starbucks has replaced its Indian-origin CEO Laxman Narasimhan with Brian Niccol, chief executive at Chipotle.

title: Why Starbucks Fired Laxman Narasimhan A Year After His Appointment As CEO
content: Starbucks said Tuesday that Brian Niccol, chief executive at Chipotle, would be the coffee chain's new CEO -- just over a year after current boss Laxman Narasimhan took over the role.
summary: Starbucks said Tuesday that Brian Niccol, chief executive at Chipotle, would be the coffee chain's new CEO -- just over a year after current boss Laxman Narasimhan took over the role.

title: After 3 Years Of Taliban Return, Massive Unemployment Persists In Afghanistan
content: Despite three years of improved security following the end of the Taliban's insurgency, Afghanistan's economy remains stagnant and its population is in the grips of a worsening humanitarian crisis.
summary: Despite three years of improved security following the end of the Taliban's insurgency, Afghanistan's economy remains stagnant and its population is in the grips of a worsening humanitarian crisis.
